intro: Silene lagascae, commonly known as the mountain catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its distinctive pink or purple flowers and succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly habitats, thriving in cool, moist environments at high altitudes. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Silene lagascae is known for its resilience to harsh climatic conditions, making it a hardy species adapted to mountainous terrain.
